# attributedTitle

**Instance Property**

The attributed string that is displayed at the status item’s position in the status bar.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying var attributedTitle: NSAttributedString? { get set }
```

## Discussion

If an image is also set, the title appears to the right of the image.

## Deprecated

- **isEnabled**: A Boolean that indicates whether the status item is enabled to respond to clicks.
- **target**: The target object to which the status item’s action message is sent when the status item is clicked.
- **action**: The selector that is sent to the status item’s target when the status item is clicked.
- **doubleAction**: The selector that is sent to the status item’s target when the status item is double-clicked.
- **sendAction(on:)**: Sets the conditions on which the status item sends action messages to its target.
- **popUpMenu(_:)**: Displays a menu under a custom status bar item.
- **title**: The string that is displayed at the status item’s position in the status bar.
- **image**: The image that is displayed at the status item’s position in the status bar.
- **alternateImage**: The alternate image to be displayed when a status bar item is highlighted.
- **highlightMode**: A Boolean that indicates whether the status item is highlighted when it is clicked.
- **toolTip**: The tool tip string that is displayed when the cursor pauses over the status item.
- **view**: The custom view that is displayed at the status item’s position in the status bar.
- **drawStatusBarBackground(in:withHighlight:)**: Draws the menu background pattern for a custom status-bar item in regular or highlight pattern.
